icontrol.drivers

Class Device

  • java.lang.Object
    • icontrol.drivers.Device
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Agilent4155, AgilentE4980A, Arduino, EksplaNT340, EksplaPG122, EurothermTC, GenericGPIB, GenericRS232, HP3561, HP4140, HP4192, iC_Instrument, Keithley2600, Keithley7001, Lakeshore625, LakeshoreTC, LAN_Instrument, LM500, NewInstrument, SRS_DS345, SRS_SR850, YokogawaDL9000

    public class Device
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the base class from which all other Instrument-Classes should be derived. It implements basic functionality such as opening the instrument via the GPIB bus.

    Note: After instantiating this class, use setInstrumentClassName to ensure generically defined methods can be found. See also the comment at the constructor.

    Consult the main page of the javadoc for instructions on how to write new Instrument-Classes.

    Instrument Commands:

    • SendCommand(String)
    • SpeedTest(int)
    • QueryCommand(String)
    Version:
    0.4
    Author:
    KPP (Kurt Pernstich: pernstich@alumni.ethz.ch)

      • m_UsedInstruments

        protected static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,Device> m_UsedInstruments
        Holds the instances of the Instruments according to their name. It is shared between all instruments derived from Device. This is actually only a "reference" to Dispatcher.m_UsedInstruments and it is assigned in the Dispatcher's constructor.

        protected static GUI_Interface m_GUI
        Holds a reference to the IcontrolView class. Could also use IcontrolApp.getApplication.getView() instead of passing it in with setGUI(); getView was introduced with JUnit tests on 120727 (v1.3.469).

      • m_NoCommunicationModeLocal

        private boolean m_NoCommunicationModeLocal
        When set to true, the instrument of this instance is set into a no-communication-mode where no I/O communication takes place. Can only be set from OpenXYZ when, for instance, OpenGPIB failed and the user chose to enter a No-Communication-Mode.

      • m_NoCommunicationModeGlobal

        private static boolean m_NoCommunicationModeGlobal
        When set to true, all Instruments derived from Device are set into a no-communication-mode where no GPIB communication takes place. Can be set/reset using setNoCommunicationModeGlobal.

      • m_SyntaxCheckMode

        private static boolean m_SyntaxCheckMode
        When set to true, no methods in Instruments classes derived from Device are called, unless they bare an iC_Annotation with MethodChecksSyntax set to true. This value is set in Dispatcher.setSyntaxCheckMode(boolean)

      • m_LockGPIBController

        protected static java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantLock m_LockGPIBController
        Stores the Lock for the GPIB controller. Using a Lock on a per GPIB address makes no sense, because who knows how the GPIB controller behaves when two Instruments are addresses interleaved. For the NI driver the single thread methods are used anyways.

        Defines the format of the time stamp which precedes lines in the Comm logger Could be changed to HH:mm:ss.S

      • m_GenericInstruments

        protected static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,Device.GenericInstrument> m_GenericInstruments
        Stores all generically defined GPIB Instruments. The Instrument-Class-Name is used as a key. This map is populated in loadGenericGPIBInstruments and is used in conjunction with m_InstrumentClassName in listAllScriptMethods to find all Script-Methods (a public method in an Instrument-Class) for a given Instrument.

      • m_InstrumentClassName

        protected java.lang.String m_InstrumentClassName
        Stores the Instrument-Class-Name for a particular instance of Device. It is set in HandleMakeCommand after instantiating an object and is used to access the identify the proper Instrument in all the generic GPIB Instrument defined in m_GenericGPIBInstruments.

      • m_PythonInterpreter

        private static org.python.util.PythonInterpreter m_PythonInterpreter
        Handle to the Jython/Python Interpreter. Is null if no Python statement has been issued. It's static because only one PythonInterpreter exists for all instances of Device.

      • m_JythonPromptWindow

        private static JythonPrompt m_JythonPromptWindow
        Handle to the Form (Window) that shows the Python output and the Python command line. Must be static so that the only one Jython Prompt Window is accessible in all instances of Device.

      • CHARACTER_ENCODING

        protected final java.lang.String CHARACTER_ENCODING
        Character encoding used to convert between String and byte[]

      • m_TerminationCharacters

        protected java.lang.String m_TerminationCharacters
        Termination characters (optional). These characters are appended to every message to mark the end of transmission. Introduced because the Lakeshore 332 stopped working for some commands (e.g. CSET? 2) while it continued to work for other commands. Empty per default; should be set in each Instrument class if desired.

        Note: GPIB_NI (and maybe some other driver classes or drivers) append a \n under certain circumstances, so if the termination characters are for instance \n\r, these drivers might actually send \n\r\n.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Device

        public Device()
        Default constructor that initializes some member variables. Also checks if iC.properties contains a key 'ClassName'.TerminationCharacters and if such a key is found, sets the m_TermiantionCharacters variable accordingly. Call OpenInstrument to establish a connection with the Instrument.

        Note: Most of the set... methods should be called once from the program 'above' to ensure proper function of the Device class.

        Note: If the arguments set by the above mentioned set... methods were to be passed to the constructor, derived classes would be required to override this constructor, which makes extending the functionality more complex. Therefore, it was chosen to put the effort not to forget to call any of the set... methods into programming the iC-Framework.

        TODO 1* understand why this is. Derived classes that override the default constructor should call this constructor of the base class for consistency in case something is added later.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstrumentNameIdentifier

        protected java.lang.String getInstrumentNameIdentifier()
        Instrument Name Identifier:
        If the response to *IDN? contains the Instrument Name Identifier String as returned from this method, the instrument is accepted, otherwise an Exception is thrown. If the returned String is empty, no *IDN? query will be performed (some older instruments do not support *IDN?).

        To check if the addressed instrument is really of the expected type (for instance when an instance of class Lakeshore340 is created but a Agilent 4155 has the specified GPIB address assigned) the response to *IDN? is evaluated against the returned String.

        Instrument classes implementing Instruments that support IEEE 488.2 should override this method.

        It can be advantageous to define the Instrument Name Identifier in the resource iC.properties, to enable changing this value without having to recompile the program. See the example in Agilent4155.getInstrumentNameIdentifier.

        Returns:
        The string that identifies the generic Instrument type upon an '*IDN?' query. See the Agilent4155 class for an example.

      • setSyntaxCheckMode

        public static void setSyntaxCheckMode(boolean SyntaxCheckMode)
        Enables of disables the Syntax-check mode for all Instruments derived from class Device. This is the setter method for m_SyntaxCheckMode. It is called in the run method of the Dispatcher class.

      • inSyntaxCheckMode

        public final boolean inSyntaxCheckMode()
        Get the flag for the Syntax-check mode. It is declared public to that it can be accessed from Python.
        Returns:
        true if the Syntax-check mode is enabled, and no IO-communication or other operations should be performed.

      • setNoCommunicationModeGlobal

        public static void setNoCommunicationModeGlobal(boolean NoCommunicationModeGlobal)
        Setter method for m_NoCommunicationModeGlobal
        Parameters:
        NoCommunicationModeGlobal - if true, no-communication-mode is enabled and no GPIB communication takes place.

      • setGPIBcontroller

        public static void setGPIBcontroller(Device.GPIBcontroller controler)
        Setter method for the used GPIB controller. It is called from IcontrolView.Start. Later implementations might allow more than one GPIB controller which is the reason why the member variable used to store the selection is called 'default'.

        This method is called after the user pressed Start, and must not be called after the Device class has been instantiated or a NullPointerException might occur.

        Parameters:
        controler - The GPIB controller to be used to communicate with the Instruments.

      • tic

        public static void tic()
        Gets the current time in milliseconds and stores it in m_tic.

      • setGUI

        public static void setGUI(GUI_Interface GUI)
        Setter method for m_GUI to grant objects of the Device class access to the GUI. Access to the GUI is thus far only needed by iC_Instrument to virtually press the 'Pause' button.
        Parameters:
        GUI - The IcontrolView object

      • StopScripting

        public static void StopScripting()
        Call this to stop processing the script. This 'signal' should be used to stop any running threads (for instance in iC_Instrument.MonitorChart, or Agilent4155.WaitUntilReady).

      • OpenInstrument

        public final void OpenInstrument(java.lang.String InstrumentName,
                                 Device.CommPorts CommPort,
                                 int GPIBAddress,
                                 java.lang.String RS232_ComPortName,
                                 int RS232_BaudRate,
                                 int RS232_DataBits,
                                 int RS232_StopBits,
                                 java.lang.String RS232_Parity,
                                 java.net.URL LAN_InstrumentURL,
                                 java.lang.String TMCTL_Wire,
                                 java.lang.String TMCTL_Address)
                          throws javax.script.ScriptException
        After instantiating an object, this method is called from Dispatcher.HandleMakeCommand to establish a connection to the Instrument. Currently, only GPIB, RS232, TMCTL and LAN (TCP) communication is implemented.

        If this method is called while in Syntax-Check-Mode, the specialized 'OpenPort' method for the chosen communication protocol (for instance OpenGPIB is not called, because there is no need to check this syntax. However, the chosen communication protocol is stored, in case some Instrument methods perform a Syntax-Check which depends on the chosen communication protocol.

        The specialized 'OpenPort' method is also not called if in No-Communication-Mode.

        If a derived class needs extra initialization after IO communication was established then override the Open method, which is also called by Dispatcher.HandleMakeCommand; see the javadoc there.

        Parameters:
        InstrumentName - The Instrument-Name of this instance, for instance 'Tsample', or 'PA'. At the time of writing it's only used in LakeshoreTC.MonitorTemp
        CommPort - Defines the port/protocol used to communicate with the Instrument.
        GPIBAddress - The GPIB address of the instrument. For RS232 communication this parameter is ignored.
        RS232_ComPortName - The name of the RS232 port, for instance 'COM1'. For GPIB communication this parameter is ignored.
        RS232_BaudRate - The baud rate for RS232 communication. For GPIB communication this parameter is ignored.
        RS232_DataBits - The number of data bits for RS232 communication. For GPIB communication this parameter is ignored.
        RS232_StopBits - The number of stop bits for RS232 communication. For GPIB communication this parameter is ignored.
        RS232_Parity - The parity for RS232 communication. For GPIB communication this parameter is ignored.
        LAN_InstrumentURL - The URL (including protocol) of the instrument. Will be null if an other protocol than LAN has been selected
        TMCTL_Wire - The 'Wire' parameter for the TMCTL library. It determines which communication port should be used. See TMCLT's documentation for details.
        TMCTL_Address - The address specifier for the instrument. It's meaning depends on TMTCL_Wire.
        Throws:
        javax.script.ScriptException - when the selected communication port/protocol has not been implemented; this should actually never occur
        See Also:
        Device.CommPorts, OpenGPIB(int)

      • OpenGPIB

        protected final void OpenGPIB(int GPIBAddress)
                       throws javax.script.ScriptException
        Establishes the connection to the instrument via GPIB bus using a class derived from GPIB_Driver, that is GPIB_NI, GPIB_Prologix or GPIB_IOtech.

        This specialized 'OpenPort' method is called from OpenInstrument only if not in Syntax-Check Mode and if not in No-Communication Mode.

        If additional initialization is required after IO communication has been established, override Device.Open; see the javadoc there for more details.

        If the String returned by getInstrumentNameIdentifier is not empty, then the response to a *IDN? query is used to ensure that the addressed instrument is of the expected type (for instance it is a Lakeshore 340 and not an Agilent 4155).

        Parameters:
        GPIBAddress - the GPIB address of the instrument
        Throws:
        javax.script.ScriptException - when 1) the Instrument did not respond to a *IDN? query with the expected answer (specified in m_InstrumentNameIdentifier) and the user has chosen to change the script (not to enter No-Communication-Mode).
        See Also:
        getInstrumentNameIdentifier()

      • OpenRS232

        protected final void OpenRS232(java.lang.String ComPortName,
                               int BaudRate,
                               int DataBits,
                               int StopBits,
                               java.lang.String Parity)
                        throws javax.script.ScriptException
        Establishes the connection to the instrument via RS232 using the class RS232_Driver.

        This specialized 'OpenPort' method is called from OpenInstrument only if not in Syntax-Check Mode and if not in No-Communication Mode.

        If additional initialization is required after IO communication has been established, override Device.Open; see the javadoc there for more details.

        Parameters:
        ComPortName - The name of the RS232 port, for instance 'COM1'.
        BaudRate - The baud rate for RS232 communication.
        DataBits - The number of data bits for RS232 communication.
        StopBits - The number of stop bits for RS232 communication.
        Parity - The parity for RS232 communication. Can be 'none', 'even', 'odd', or 'mark' (case insensitive).
        Throws:
        javax.script.ScriptException - When the RS232 port could not be opened (bubbles up from OpenPort).

      • OpenLAN

        protected final void OpenLAN(java.net.URL InstrumentURL)
                      throws javax.script.ScriptException
        Establishes the connection to the instrument via LAN (TCP) using Java's support for TCP-IP communication.

        This specialized 'OpenPort' method is called from OpenInstrument only if not in Syntax-Check Mode and if not in No-Communication Mode.

        If additional initialization is required after IO communication has been established, override Device.Open; see the javadoc there for more details.

        Parameters:
        InstrumentURL - the URL of the instrument (IP address or host name). The protocol, port number and file are defined in the iC.properties.
        Throws:
        javax.script.ScriptException - when the network connection could not be established.

      • OpenTMCTL

        protected final void OpenTMCTL(java.lang.String Wire,
                               java.lang.String Address)
                        throws javax.script.ScriptException
        Establishes the connection to the instrument via Yokogawa's TMCTL library by using class TMCTL_Driver. The communication port used is determined by Wire. At the time of writing, only the USB port for the DL9000 Series osciloscope is suported.

        This specialized 'OpenPort' method is called from OpenInstrument only if not in Syntax-Check Mode and if not in No-Communication Mode.

        If additional initialization is required after IO communication has been established, override Device.Open; see the javadoc there for more details.

        If the String returned by getInstrumentNameIdentifier is not empty, then the response to a *IDN? query is used to ensure that the addressed instrument is of the expected type (for instance it is a Lakeshore 340 and not an Agilent 4155). At time of writing, this string is empty becuase one has to enter the Serial Number, so it's quite certain that the instrument is a DL9000.

        Parameters:
        Wire - Determines which communication port is used by the TMCTL library. Could be one of the following: GPIB, RS232, USB, Ethernet, USBTMC(DL9000), EthernetUDP, USBTMC(excluding DL9000), VXI-11. At time of writing, only USBTMC(DL9000) is implemented.
        Address - The address specifier of the instrument; the content depends on the chosen Wire parameter. For USBTMC(DL9000) Address needs to contain the erial Number of the Instrument.
        Throws:
        javax.script.ScriptException - when 1) the Instrument did not respond to a *IDN? query with the expected answer (specified in getInstrumentNameIdentifier) and the user has chosen to change the script (not to enter No-Communication-Mode).

      • Open

        public void Open()
          throws java.io.IOException,
                 javax.script.ScriptException
        A method for additional initializations after establishing the connection to the Instrument. This method is called from Dispatcher.HandleMakeCommand after calling OpenInstrument.

        Note that this method is not called when in Syntax-Check mode or when in No-Communication mode!

        When GPIB communication is selected, the default implementation assumes that the Instrument implements IEEE 488.2 (which is the case for most modern instruments) and sends *CLS to clear the Instrument's interface, and checks the type of Instrument by calling checkIDN. If a GPIB Instrument does not support IEEE 488.2 functions this method should be overridden in the derived class to avoid communication errors.

        If communication protocol other than GPIB is selected, this default implementation does nothing.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when an sending / receiving data caused a GPIB error
        javax.script.ScriptException - when the response to a *IDN? query does not match the expected result; bubbles up from checkIDN.

      • checkIDN

        protected void checkIDN()
                 throws javax.script.ScriptException
        Reads the response to a *IDN? query if not in No-Communication mode and stores it in the member variable m_IDN. If the global switch iC.EnableIDNcheck in iC.properties is set to '1' then this method checks if the response to the *IDN? query matches the expected response for the Instrument returned from getInstrumentNameIdentifier. If this expected response is an empty String (no InstrumentNameIdentifier has been defined in iC.properties this method just returns. This method simply returns if the chosen communication protocol is different from GPIB.

        When the response to *IDN? does not match the expected result, the user is presented with a dialog to choose an action.

        Throws:
        javax.script.ScriptException - If the GPIB address is wrong
        See Also:
        WrongIDN

      • CloseController

        public final void CloseController()
                           throws java.io.IOException
        This method is called one time after the Script has been processed (from Dispatcher.run), and is used to close the connection to the Communication driver. If new drivers (GPIB, USB, Ethernet, ...) are added to iC, this method should be updated, but typically this method does not need to be overridden, so it is declared final.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Bubbles up from the Communication driver's CloseController method (GPIB_NI or GPIB_Prologix or FTD2xxj)

      • Close

        public void Close()
           throws java.io.IOException
        This method is called for all the used Instruments after processing the script. It can be used to "clean up" the Instrument state. The connection to the Instrument is closed in CloseInstrument, which is called from Dispatcher.run after processing the script has been finished. CloseInstrument tries to switch the Instrument to 'local' mode.

        Note that this method is also called when an error occurred during opening of the instrument. It might therefore be necessary to check if the driver used to communicate with the instrument is valid. Remark: This method is not called when in Syntax-Check mode or when in NoCommunication Mode.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When a GPIB error occurred during closing the connection to the Instrument
        See Also:
        CloseInstrument()

      • CloseInstrument

        public void CloseInstrument()
                     throws java.io.IOException
        This method is called from Dispatcher.run for all the used Instruments after processing the script. It closes the connection to the Instrument. It is usually not necessary to override this method, therefore it is defined final. If a new GPIB/USB/Ethernet/... driver is added to iC, this method should also be updated.

        This method calls CloseInstrument in the driver class (for instance GPIB_NI and GPIB_Prologix). These methods try to switch the Instrument to 'local' mode and then close the connection. For RS232 communication it closes the serial port, and for LAN communication it closes the input/output streams to the URL. For the TMCTL library it calls TMCTL's Finish method

        Remark: This method is not called when in Syntax-Check mode or when in NoCommunication Mode.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When a GPIB error occurred during closing the connection to the Instrument
        See Also:
        CloseInstrument()

      • setUsedInstruments

        public static void setUsedInstruments(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,Device> UsedInstruments)
        Setter method for the HashMap that stores all used instruments. The HashMap UsedInstruments is created in Dispatcher. Some instruments might require access to other instruments, when they, for instance, save data to a file and want to append the actual temperature measured by an other instrument to the file name. This
        Parameters:
        UsedInstruments - Holds the instances of all used Instruments

      • setInstrumentClassName

        public void setInstrumentClassName(java.lang.String InstrumentClassName)
        Setter method for the Instrument-Class-Name.
        Parameters:
        InstrumentClassName - The Instrument-Class-Name for the particular instance.

      • inNoCommunicationMode

        public final boolean inNoCommunicationMode()
        Determines if this instance of the instrument is in simulation mode where no GPIB communication takes place. An instrument can be in simulation mode when either the global simulation mode is enabled, or this instrument is specifically set to simulation mode during instantiation.
        Returns:
        true if this instrument is in simulation mode

      • isPaused

        public boolean isPaused(boolean WaitUntilNotPaused)
        This method calls @link{IcontrolView.isPaused}. See the javadoc for this method.
        Parameters:
        WaitUntilNotPaused - see @link{IcontrolView.isPaused}
        Returns:
        see @link{IcontrolView.isPaused}

      • DispatchCommand

        public final java.lang.Object DispatchCommand(java.lang.String CommandLine)
                                       throws javax.script.ScriptException
        Processes a Command-Line that addresses an Instrument. It first identifies the Instance of the addressed Instrument, then finds the method implementing the command, and calls this method with the appropriate parameters.

        The DispatchCommand of this base class for other Instrument classes uses Reflection to find a method (in the base and in derived classes) with a name and the number of parameters as specified in the Script (Device Command). If such a method is found, it tries to convert the specified parameters into the appropriate variable types and calls the method. The method name (Device Command) is case sensitive. Two methods with the same name can exist as long as the number of parameters is different.

        Note that only those device commands can be handled that take arguments of type String, Integer, Double, Float, or Boolean.

        Remark: This method can also be invoked from within methods in Instrument Classes to, for instance, get the current temperature of an Instrument to append this value to the file name.

        Remark: Only methods of classes derived from Device are considered here. This can be useful, because the Reflection mechanism also lists methods such as, for instance, java.lang.Object wait(), while an Instrument class might also implement a wait() method. If this requirement should be lifted, see the remarks in Dispatcher at the bookmark BM_LiftRequirement.

        Remark: Any exception thrown by the invoked method (the method in the Instrument Class which handles the Device Command) should also be handled by the invoked method, because no code exists 'above' that which could handle the Exception better.

        Remark: This method is static because it is called from the Dispatcher class without a specific object. It would of course also be possible to create a dummy object in the Dispatcher. I don't know which way is more elegant, so I chose to make this method static. This also required to make getInteger etc. static.

        Developing Remark: Originally this method was made static, but when multiple Command Lines are dispatched it's probably safer not to overwrite the variables used in DispatchCommand. I did not quite get my head around that, but I remove the static for now, and keep thinking. See also the remark in javadoc (How to write new Instrument-Classes).

        Parameters:
        CommandLine - to be dispatched and processed. The first Token in the Command Line contains the Instrument Name, and the remainder contains the Instrument Command and the Parameters. An example would be the String "Tstage SetTemp; 325.0" or "PA Measure; 0; Id,Vd,Ig,Vg; .trans"
        Returns:
        The Object that is returned by the method called by the Reflection mechanism. See remark above. IMPORTANT: The returned Object is null when in Syntax-Check mode or when the returned Object is null. Always perform a check for !null when using this return value!
        Throws:
        javax.script.ScriptException - is thrown when 1) the specified Instrument Name was not recognized, or 2) the Script-Command did not contain a Device-Command, or 3) none or more than one functions with the same name and number of arguments are found, or 4) when an error occurred when the strings were converted into the appropriate variable type, or 5) when the Syntax-check failed, or 6) when the invoked method threw an Exception.

      • SendToInstrument

        public void SendToInstrument(java.lang.String Message)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Sends a string to the instrument using the communication port defined when opening the Instrument (m_UsedCommPort). The String to be sent is logged to m_Comm_Logger. This method exits if without sending if in No-Communication-Mode. Termination characters are appended if defined.

        This method uses a Lock depending on the communication port to ensure thread safety. Remark: To prevent unintended behavior on non-English environments (where the decimal point might not be '.' but ',') it is recommended to use the Locale.US, for instance like String.format(Locale.US, ....

        Parameters:
        Message - that will be logged and sent to the Instrument. The termination characters defined in m_TerminationCharacters are appended before sending.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the transmission caused a communication error; bubbles up from the respective driver, e.g. GPIB_Driver.SendCommand.

      • SendViaGPIB

        @Deprecated
protected final void SendViaGPIB(java.lang.String Message)
                                      throws java.io.IOException
        Deprecated. Use SendToInstrument instead
        Sends a string via GPIB to the instrument if it is not in No-Communication-Mode. The String to send is in any case logged to m_Comm_Logger.

        This method uses a Lock on the GPIB controller to ensure thread safety. Note: Declaring the method as synchronized resulted in communication errors when different threads tried to access the same instrument.

        Remark: To prevent unintended behavior on non-English environments (where the decimal point might not be '.' but ',') it is recommended to use the Locale.US, for instance like String.format(Locale.US, ....

        Parameters:
        Message - is sent to the GPIB
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the transmission caused a GPIB error; bubbles up from GPIB_Driver.SendCommand or if a driver not derived from GPIB_Driver was used (should only occur during development).

      • SendViaRS232

        protected final void SendViaRS232(java.nio.ByteBuffer Message)
                           throws java.io.IOException
        Sends ByteBuffer Message via RS232 to the instrument if it is not in No-Communication-Mode. The bytes to send are in any case logged to m_Comm_Logger.

        This method uses a Lock on the RS232 controller to ensure thread safety. See remark in SendViaGPIB.

        Parameters:
        Message - is sent over the RS232.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the transmission caused an error; bubbles up from RS232_Driver.SendCommand.

      • SendViaRS232

        @Deprecated
protected final void SendViaRS232(java.lang.String Message)
                                       throws java.io.IOException
        Deprecated. Use SendToInstrument instead
        Sends a string via RS232 to the instrument if it is not in No-Communication-Mode. The String to send is in any case logged to m_Comm_Logger. To convert the string into 8-bit values the character set UTF-8 is used.

        Remark: To prevent unintended behavior on non-English environments (where the decimal point might not be '.' but ',') it is recommended to use the Locale.US, for instance like String.format(Locale.US, ....

        Parameters:
        Message - is sent over the RS232. Conversion from String to byte[] is done using the UTF-8 character set.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the transmission caused an error; bubbles up from RS232_Driver.SendCommand.

                                     throws java.io.IOException
        Deprecated. Implement and use SendToInstrument instead
        Sends a string via LAN (TCP) to the instrument if it is not in No-Communication-Mode. The String to send is in any case logged to m_Comm_Logger.

        This method uses a Lock on the GPIB controller to ensure thread safety. Note: Declaring the method as synchronized resulted in communication errors when different threads tried to access the same instrument.

        Remark: To prevent unintended behavior on non-English environments (where the decimal point might not be '.' but ',') it is recommended to use the Locale.US, for instance like String.format(Locale.US, ....

        Parameters:
        Message - is sent to the GPIB
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the transmission caused a GPIB error; bubbles up from GPIB_Driver.SendCommand.

      • SendViaTMCTL

        Sends a string via the TMCTL library to the instrument if it is not in No-Communication-Mode. The String to send is in any case logged to m_Comm_Logger.

        This method uses a Lock on the TMCTL library to ensure thread safety. Note: Declaring the method as synchronized resulted in communication errors when different threads tried to access the same instrument.

        Remark: To prevent unintended behavior on non-English environments (where the decimal point might not be '.' but ',') it is recommended to use the Locale.US, for instance like String.format(Locale.US, ....

        Parameters:

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the transmission caused a TMCTL error; bubbles up from TMCTL_Driver.SendCommand.

      • QueryInstrument

        protected java.lang.String QueryInstrument(java.lang.String Message)
                                    throws java.io.IOException
        Sends a string via the chosed communication port to the Instrument, and reads the Instrument's reply. Does that only if the Instrument is not in No-Communication-Mode. The String to send and a possible answer is logged to m_Comm_Logger.

        This method uses a Lock on the chosed communication port to ensure thread safety.

        Remark: To prevent unintended behavior on non-English environments (where the decimal point might not be '.' but ',') it is recommended to use the Locale.US, for instance like String.format(Locale.US, ....

        Parameters:
        Message - is sent over the chosen communication port, e.g. GPIB.
        Returns:
        Returns the string read from the instrument, or an empty String if in No-Communication-Mode.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the transmission caused a communication error; bubbles up from the respective communication driver, e.g. GPIB_Driver.SendCommand or GPIB_Driver.Receive.

      • QueryViaGPIB

        @Deprecated
protected final java.lang.String QueryViaGPIB(java.lang.String Message)
                                                   throws java.io.IOException
        Deprecated. Use QueryInstrument instead
        Sends a string via GPIB to the Instrument, and reads the Instrument's reply. Does that only if the Instrument is not in No-Communication-Mode. The String to send and a possible answer is logged to m_Comm_Logger.

        This method uses a Lock on the GPIB controller to ensure thread safety. Note: Declaring the method as synchronized resulted in communication errors when different threads tried to access the same instrument.

        Remark: To prevent unintended behavior on non-English environments (where the decimal point might not be '.' but ',') it is recommended to use the Locale.US, for instance like String.format(Locale.US, ....

        Parameters:
        Message - is sent over the GPIB.
        Returns:
        Returns the string read from GPIB, or an empty String if in No-Communication-Mode.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the transmission caused a GPIB error; bubbles up from GPIB_Driver.SendCommand or GPIB_Driver.Receive.

      • QueryViaRS232

        @Deprecated
protected final java.lang.String QueryViaRS232(java.lang.String Message)
                                                    throws java.io.IOException
        Deprecated. Use QueryInstrument instead
        Sends a string via RS232 to the Instrument, and reads the Instrument's reply. Does that only if the Instrument is not in No-Communication-Mode. The String to send and a possible answer is logged to m_Comm_Logger.

        Remark: To prevent unintended behavior on non-English environments (where the decimal point might not be '.' but ',') it is recommended to use the Locale.US, for instance like String.format(Locale.US, ....

        Parameters:
        Message - is sent over the RS232. To convert the string to and from 8-bit values, the character set UTF-8 is used.
        Returns:

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the transmission caused a RS232 error; bubbles up from RS232_Driver.SendCommand or RS232_Driver.Receive.

      • QueryViaRS232

        protected final java.nio.ByteBuffer QueryViaRS232(java.nio.ByteBuffer Message,
                                                  int WaitTime)
                                           throws java.io.IOException
        Sends the ByteBuffer via RS232 to the Instrument, and reads the Instrument's reply. Does that only if the Instrument is not in No-Communication-Mode. The ByteBuffer to send and a possible answer are logged to m_Comm_Logger.

        Parameters:
        Message - is sent over the RS232. To query with an empty argument use QueryViaRS232(ByteBuffer.allocate(0)).
        WaitTime - in msec waited between sending the message and receiving the answer; this is used for the EurothermTC to signal End-Of-Transmission. Can be 0.
        Returns:
        Returns the data read from RS232, or a ByteBuffer with a limit of 0 if in No-Communication-Mode. The return value should never be null.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the transmission caused a RS232 error; bubbles up from RS232_Driver.SendCommand or RS232_Driver.Receive.

      • SendCommand

        @AutoGUIAnnotation(DescriptionForUser="Sends a String to the Instrument (via GPIB or RS232)",
                   ParameterNames="String to send",
                   ToolTips="")
public final void SendCommand(java.lang.String Message)
                                                                                                                                                                                                         throws javax.script.ScriptException
        Handles the SENDCOMMAND command.

        The SENDCOMMAND command sends the given string directly to the chosen instrument. Supports GPIB and RS232 communication.

        Parameters:
        Message - is the String that is sent to the instrument.
        Throws:
        javax.script.ScriptException - bubbles up from SendViaGPIB or from SendViaRS232.

      • QueryCommand

        @AutoGUIAnnotation(DescriptionForUser="<html>Sends a String to the Instrument and addresses the Instrument<br> to talk. The result is made available to the subsequent script command",
                   ParameterNames="String to send",
                   ToolTips="")
public final java.lang.String QueryCommand(java.lang.String Message)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                throws javax.script.ScriptException
        Handles the QUERYCOMMAND command.

        The QUERYCOMMAND command sends the given string directly to the chosen instrument, and addresses the instrument to talk. The received answer is made available to the subsequent script-command.Supports GPIB and RS232 communication.

        Parameters:
        Message - is the String that is sent to the instrument.
        Returns:
        The Instrument's response
        Throws:
        javax.script.ScriptException - bubbles up from QueryInstrument.

      • SpeedTest

        public void SpeedTest(int NrIterations)
        Performs a speed test of the currently selected GPIB controller by requesting the Instrument to send the Identification query. The ID of the instrument is shown in the Status Text together with the time between successive queries.

        Note that no Auto GUI is supplied as this method is intended for debugging only.

        Parameters:
        NrIterations - Specifies how many times the *IDN? query should be performed.
        See Also:
        GPIB_Driver.SpeedTest(int)

      • findScriptMethod

        protected ScriptMethod findScriptMethod(java.lang.String Name,
                                        int NrOfArguments)
                                 throws javax.script.ScriptException
        Finds the specified method from the available programmatic and generic script-methods. The returned object contains all information available about this method.

        Note: At present, only the method's name and number of arguments are used to identify the method. Because the structure of iC has been changed, it should not be difficult to implement a precise check of the parameter types instead, thereby enabling truly overloaded methods. It's on the to do list.

        Parameters:
        Name - The name of the method to look for.
        NrOfArguments - The number of arguments the method accepts.
        Returns:
        A ScriptMethod object identifying the method.
        Throws:
        javax.script.ScriptException - If none or more than one method was found.

      • invokeGenericScriptMethod

        private java.lang.Object invokeGenericScriptMethod(ScriptMethod Method,
                                                   java.lang.Object[] ConvertedParameters)
                                            throws java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
        Invokes a genericaly defined Script Method. The ConvertedParameters are 'filled' into the GPIB String, which is then sent to the Instrument. If the method name starts with 'get', the Instrument is addressed to talk and the result of this query is returned. If the method name starts with 'save' the result of a query is additionally save to a file. In this case, the last ConvertedParameter is interpreted as a file name.

        The Syntax-check mode works the same way as for Script Methods defined in Java, and a Range Check on the ConvertedParameters is also performed if a range was defined in the generic Script Method.

        Parameters:
        Method - The ScriptMethod to call.
        ConvertedParameters - The parameters of the method to call. The type of the parameters must match the format specifiers supplied in Method.
        Returns:
        The return value of the invoked method if Method's name starts with 'get'. Can be null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException - when 1) one of the ConvertedParameters is out of range or has an incorrect type (then the cause of InvocationTargetException is a DataFormatException), of 2) when sending or querying the command caused an error (bubbles up from SendToinstrument or QueryInstrumnet).

      • loadGenericInstrument

        public void loadGenericInstrument(java.io.File FileToLoad,
                                  java.util.TreeMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> RegisteredInstruments)
                           throws javax.script.ScriptException
        Loads the generically defined Instruments from the specified file. The File Name without extension (that is all characters before the first . (dot)) is used as the Instrument-Class-Name. The Instrument-Class-Name (the name that shows up in the ComboBox of the MAKE section of the GUI) may contain spaces.

        Additionally, it registers all generic Instruments that have not yet been registered, that is, every Instrument-Class-Name that is not yet included in Dispatcher.m_RegisteredInstruments is added to the list with GenericGPIB or GenericRS232 as Instrument-Class.

        Note that once a parsing error occurs, the remainder of file is not parsed, hence, the entire file needs to be free of errors for all methods to be available. The generic Instrument is also not registered in this case.

        Parameters:
        FileToLoad - The File which contains the generic Instrument definitions
        RegisteredInstruments - To this list of registered Instruments the generically defined Instrument-Class-Name is added given it was not already present.
        Throws:
        javax.script.ScriptException - if parsing the file failed.

      • listAllScriptMethods

        public java.util.ArrayList<ScriptMethod> listAllScriptMethods()
        Finds all Script-Methods, that is, all public methods defined in class Device or it's descendants. All public methods can be invoked from the Script, but note that not all returned methods have to bare an @AutoGUIAnnotation. This method also returns generically defined methods.
        Returns:
        A list of methods that can be invoked via script commands. The returned list might be empty but is never null.

      • execPython

        public void execPython(java.lang.String PythonCommand)
                throws javax.script.ScriptException
        Executes a Python command. If it is the first time a Python command is executed, this method also creates a new instance of the Python Interpreter by calling resetPythonInterpreter and shows the JythonPrompt window. This method also makes the return value of the last Script Command available in Python.

        Remark to Developers: The MAKE command is not supported from Python because MAKE commands are handled by the Dispatcher, and the Device class has no access to the Dispatcher. It would be easy to assign a static Dispatcher object to the Device class, but it's not elegant, and it is easy to MAKE new instruments from iC, hence, it's not necessary to use Python. Especially because it would be a big effort that the instruments made in Python would also show up in the GUI. A second way to export the Dispatcher to Python would be to have resetPythonInterpreter call a method in IcontrolView which uses Device.getPythonInterpreter to export m_Dispatcher. Maybe there is a third way.

        Parameters:
        PythonCommand - This command will be executed by the Python Interpreter. To execute multi-line Python commands, the lines must be sent in one String separated with the newline (\n) character.
        Throws:
        javax.script.ScriptException - is thrown when 1) executing a Python command (either PythonCommand or a command in Startup.py) caused a Python error, or 2) an exception bubbles up from resetPythonInterpreter.

      • resetPythonInterpreter

        public void resetPythonInterpreter(java.lang.String Message)
                            throws javax.script.ScriptException
        Resets the Python Interpreter (PI) by discarding the old PI and making a new PI. After the new PI is instantiated, the file Startup.py residing in the iC directory is executed. Needs to be public so that it can be called from the Dispatcher.
        Parameters:
        Message - will be printed in the Python output
        Throws:
        javax.script.ScriptException - when a Python Error occurred

      • getStopScripting

        public boolean getStopScripting()
        Getter method for m_StopScripting, the flag which indicates that the user has pressed the Stop button. Used to access this flag from Python.
        Returns:
        true if the user has pressed the Stop button, false otherwise.

      • getPythonInterpreter

        public org.python.util.PythonInterpreter getPythonInterpreter()
        Getter method for the Python Interpreter
        Returns:
        Returns the current PythonInterpreter or null if the Python Interpreter has not been started (because no Python commands were executed)

      • getGPIBaddress

        protected int getGPIBaddress()
        Returns the GPIB address of this Instrument or 0 if an other communication protocol was chosen

      • getFileName

        public java.lang.String getFileName(java.lang.String Extension)
        Returns the full FileName including path and extension. It calls the corresponding method in the GUI_Interface and was added to be able to access the filename from Python.

      • inJUnitTest

        protected boolean inJUnitTest()
        Returns:
        true when the program is run as JUnit Test, and false if it is run as regular program
